content:
Below are some screenshots for the screen that lets you choose email you want to login/register using GitHub auth. It'd be great to have some feedback on the design.
Selection_184.png
Selection_183.png
@Shubham Padia I’m not sure I understand this screen. Most github auth sign-In’s I’ve used pick up your email from the github info. I feel like that makes more sense?

@Armaan Ahluwalia Github allows you to have multiple emails associated with your account out of which one is primary. This screen lets you choose email out of the emails that are associated with your GitHub account.

Ah gotcha. Makes sense. My inputs -

1) Change “submit” to Continue and add 2 or 3 px padding to top and bottom wIthin the button
2) Add 3px padding around emails and make sure they are labels associated with radio buttons in order to be clickable
3) Unbold e-mail text
4) If possible choose a more friendly/affirmative button style from our other buttons on the app. Not sure if a happier green exists but it would be good to re-affirm things are going smooth to the user. I know we’re using a happier green on the save/discard buttons in organisation settings buttons but this may not be the apt time to extract that style out of the module. Others may have an opinion on this :smiley:
What does the "log in with google" email choosing thing look like?

@Rishi Gupta The default choose email link is visible in google auth flow
Selection_186.png
I don't think GitHub has a screen for choosing emails.

Below is a screenshot working on @Armaan Ahluwalia 's suggestion.
Selection_187.png
Additionally I would be tempted to reuse the radio button style found in Emoji style under Display Settings. Other than that I think it looks good to me

For google, when you click on an account, does it pick it immediately? Or do you click it and then click Next?

Also unrelatedly I would exclude the noreply.github.com email

It picks it up immediately, if you click on the email card-sort-of-thing.

Also unrelatedly I would exclude the noreply.github.com email

Thanks for mentioning that :). I didn't realise it.

Sorry to disrupt the flow of conversation but purely aesthetically I would in addition include the 1px border found in the emoji style picker under the labels as well.

      border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,.2);

I would be tempted to reuse the radio button style found in Emoji style under Display Settings

Both the styles are same I think.

I'll try the bottom border thing out.
Does it make sense to have the first email selected by default so you save on a click in case thats the one you want? Not sure if thats what rishi meant as well.
Yeah, first mail should be selected by default. I think Rishi was referring to something else.
yeah, I think we possibly don't need a "continue" button at all, if each of the emails has a button-like outline on hover.
Makes sense to me. If possible we should ensure the back button functionality is working with this approach!
Yeah, we should do something as close to the Google auth design as possible (keeping in mind that the Google auth screen is part of Google's site, so we'll need to write our own CSS).
Cool :smiley:
Will the gravatar (maybe different for different emails) and full name be shown with the email as they'll be same for all the emails listed?
Think gravatar would be cool but maybe the name would be too much repetition?
The full names will all be the same, so I guess that doesn't make sense.

And I don't think the gravatar is a great idea either. I could imagine having the code check whether the email already has an account in that Zulip organization, and showing the avatar for that account in that case, but that feels like a v2 thing.
So I'd consider just using the GitHub logo for the avatar spot, or just doing buttons in similar design/size to the Google thing, with the email address in the middle.
(I guess that'd look more like our /devlogin page)
Doing buttons with the email address in the middle sounds better to me
Yeah, let's just do that.

With inputs from @Rishi Gupta, another iteration of the design is as follows:
Peek-2018-07-14-22-21.gif
@Shubham Padia I think that's the right shape and good enough to submit; we'll want to do some styling work but it should be really quick for design-focused folks to do that.
Cool
